senses.de: To cause something to exist or happen
senses.ex: The new project will generate many jobs

Tips.title: Action Initiation
Tips.description: Emphasizes starting processes or activities; often tied to creation or innovation.
Tips.example: The new policy will generate positive changes within the company.

Tips.title: Causality Emphasis
Tips.description: Highlights the cause-and-effect relationship, where 'generate' introduces the result.
Tips.example: Increased investment will generate higher economic growth.

Tips.title: Positive Connotation
Tips.description: Often used with a positive outcome in mind, though not exclusively.
Tips.example: The fundraiser event will generate much-needed funds for the school.

senses.de: In science, to produce energy or a particular type of energy
senses.ex: The windmills can be used to generate electricity

Tips.title: Technical Energy
Tips.description: Commonly used to describe the creation of energy in a technical or scientific context.
Tips.example: Solar panels generate clean energy from sunlight.

Tips.title: Scientific Precision
Tips.description: Used for precision in scientific contexts, discussing exact processes or results.
Tips.example: The generator can efficiently generate 5 kilowatts of electricity.

Tips.title: Environmental Relevance
Tips.description: Often associated with renewable energy and environment-friendly practices.
Tips.example: Wind farms generate power without polluting the air.

senses.de: In mathematics, to produce a set or sequence of items by performing specified operations
senses.ex: The formula generates a sequence of prime numbers

Tips.title: Mathematical Creation
Tips.description: In mathematics, focuses on the production of sequences or sets with specific properties.
Tips.example: Applying the algorithm will generate the desired number pattern.

Tips.title: Algorithmic Use
Tips.description: Often used in the context of algorithms generating outcomes in mathematics or computing.
Tips.example: This recursive function will generate all possible permutations.

senses.de: In computing, to produce data or a program by using a set of rules
senses.ex: The system generates a unique identification for each user

Tips.title: Automated Processes
Tips.description: In computing, it implies the automatic creation of programs, data, or codes by the system.
Tips.example: The script will generate a summary report every hour.

Tips.title: System Efficiency
Tips.description: Indicates a system's capability to efficiently produce needed information.
Tips.example: The software can quickly generate comprehensive user analytics.

Tips.title: Programming Context
Tips.description: Used when discussing the outcome of a coding or programming task.
Tips.example: Once compiled, the program will generate the final output.

Breed.wordDefinition:
Breed refers to the process of producing offspring from animals or plants of a certain species with desired characteristics, such as breeding two purebred dogs to produce a litter of puppies.

Breed is applicable in the context of reproduction of animals or plants, while generate is applicable in the context of creating something new, such as energy or ideas.

Create.wordDefinition:
The words create and generate both mean to make something new, but they are used in slightly different contexts.

To create something means to bring it into existence from scratch, often by using your own imagination or skill. For example, an artist might create a painting, a musician might create a new song, or a writer might create a story.

The key difference between these two words is that create implies a greater degree of originality and personal input, while generate implies a more systematic or automatic process.

Develop.wordDefinition:
The words develop and generate are related to creating something new or making something grow, but they are used in different contexts.

Develop means to improve and make something more advanced, such as developing new technology or skills. For instance, a scientist can develop a new medicine to cure a disease.

Develop is used when improving something, while generate is used when making or producing something new.

Engender.wordDefinition:
Engender means to produce or create something new, typically a feeling, reaction, or situation.

The difference between these two words is that engender refers to the production of a non-tangible outcome, usually resulting from circumstances or actions, while generate refers to the production of a tangible or quantifiable outcome resulting from specific actions or processes.

Fabricate.wordDefinition:
Fabricate means to create or invent something that isn't real or true.

It is often used when referring to something that has been made up or fabricated as a lie or untrue story. For example, "He fabricated a story about winning the lottery to impress his friends.”.

Fabricate refers to creating something that is not true or real, while generate refers to producing something that is real or tangible.

Formulate.wordDefinition:
Formulate means to come up with a plan, idea or strategy by careful thought and consideration. It usually involves having a goal, analyzing the situation and then creating a plan to achieve that goal.

For example, a scientist might formulate a hypothesis based on research and evidence.

Formulate is used when you want to plan or strategize, while generate is used when you want to produce or create something.

Make.wordDefinition:
Make means to create or put together something using materials, tools, or actions. For example, a person can make a cake by mixing ingredients together and baking it in an oven.

Generate is used when referring to the production of something that requires a system or process (like electricity or ideas) while make is used when referring to the creation of something physical (like a cake or a table).

Manufacture.wordDefinition:
Manufacture means to produce goods, typically on a large scale using industrial processes. For example, a car manufacturer produces cars by assembling various components together.

In simple terms, generating is about producing energy or power, while manufacturing is about producing goods through industrial processes.

Generate is applicable in the context of energy, whereas manufacture is applicable in the context of production of goods.

Originate.wordDefinition:
Generate means to produce or create something new, while originate means to begin or start something.

For example, a power plant can generate electricity by producing it through various processes, while an idea can originate from a person's mind, which means that it is the starting point of that idea.

Generate is used when referring to the act of creating or producing something, while originate is used when referring to the beginning or starting point of something.

Procreate.wordDefinition:
Procreate specifically refers to the act of reproducing or having offspring.

Generate covers a wider range of actions and is not specific to reproduction, while procreate is focused solely on the act of creating offspring.

Produce.wordDefinition:
Both generate and produce mean to create something, but the difference is in how they create it. Generate means to create something using a process or method, while produce means to create something by physically making or manufacturing it.

For example, you can generate electricity using wind turbines, but you produce clothing in a factory.

In simpler terms, generate is used when talking about creating something through a mental or technical process, while produce is used when talking about physically making something.

Spawn.wordDefinition:
Both generate and spawn mean to produce or create something.

Spawn is frequently used to depict the production of something naturally or spontaneously.

For instance, fish spawn in water to lay eggs, and mushrooms spawn on decaying wood.

In summary, use generate when describing something produced through a process or method, and use spawn when describing something created naturally or spontaneously.

videos.Text: Surprisingly, agriculture is the biggest contributor to climate change. It generates 30% of greenhouse gas emissions. That's more than the emissions from all electricity and industry, or from all the world's planes, trains and automobiles. Most agricultural emissions come from tropical deforestation, methane from animals and rice fields, and nitrous oxide from over-fertilizing.

quotes.Text: Your competition is not other people but the time you kill, the ill will you create, the knowledge you neglect to learn, the connections you fail to build, the health you sacrifice along the path, your inability to generate ideas, the people around you who don't support and love your efforts, and whatever god you curse for your bad luck.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: James Altucher

quotes.Text: It's hard for me to find a script that's perfectly suited to me, so even if it's a good script, I'll still have to work on it with someone and shape it, making it the film that I want to make. So in that respect, I prefer to do the stuff that I've generated anyway.
quotes.Title: Greek Director
quotes.Name: Yorgos Lanthimos

quotes.Text: There are interactions with characters within the game which I think are pretty neatly done considering the limitations that you have to work with. I mean, a computer can't really generate a character that talks back and forth with you successfully.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Fred Saberhagen

quotes.Text: I'm trying to make perfect moments. And those generate meaning. If you go deep enough in how to make a moment, very quickly you come to how narrative works - to what we are as a species, how we've come up with telling stories in scenes and images.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Ira Glass

quotes.Text: You get paid what you deserve, according to the money that your movie generates. I get much more than a lot of male directors and I also get less than some. But I get paid what I deserve and what I ask for.
quotes.Title: Indian Director
quotes.Name: Farah Khan

quotes.Text: It is very important to generate a good attitude, a good heart, as much as possible. From this, happiness in both the short term and the long term for both yourself and others will come.
quotes.Title: Tibetan Leader
quotes.Name: Dalai Lama

quotes.Text: I enjoy living in L.A. This is where the work is - or at least generated from - because you fly off and do movies. It's sort of a great way to see the world.
quotes.Title: Australian Actress
quotes.Name: Yvonne Strahovski

quotes.Text: You can have the biggest markets in the world, but if the game isn't exciting, compelling, and competitive, it's not going to generate a lot of interest.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Gary Bettman

quotes.Text: The immigration issue is, I recognize, one that generates a lot of passion, but it does not make sense for us to want to push talent out.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Barack Obama

quotes.Text: I don't need the money I generate from photography to support myself.
quotes.Title: American Photographer
quotes.Name: Kim Weston
